newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK Bank of Canada year net up 15.8 pct.
newsitem.headline: HK Bank of Canada year net up 15.8 pct.

text.p: Hongkong Bank of Canada said on Friday that its consolidated net income for the 12 months ended October 31, 1996, rose 15.8 percent to C$118.1 million against C$102.0 million in 1995.
Total assets at October 31 were C$21.51 billion, up 9.8 percent on the year. Return on equity was 19.49 percent compared with 17.78 percent the previous year.

Net interest income grew principally as a result of growth in residential mortgages and commercial lending as lower interest rates and competitive pressures reduced margins, the bank said in a statement.

Non-funds revenues and operating expenses both grew significantly, principally from expansion of the range of services offered by the bank, while improved credit quality resulted in a lower provision charge for credit losses, it said.
Hongkong Bank of Canada is an indirectly held, wholly owned subsidiary of HSBC Holdings Plc.
